private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E.
I may only move the top disk of any peg.
I must not place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Help reach the final peg configuration specified by the environment by executing allowed primitive moves.

private_information: I can move disks F, G, H, I, J.
I may only move the top disk of any peg.
I must not place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Help reach the final peg configuration specified by the environment by executing allowed primitive moves.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their move sequences into a single plan.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined, validated PDDL domain and problem encoding the cooperative solution and compatible with the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: This is a cooperative Tower of Hanoi with 3 pegs named left, middle, right.
There are 10 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J where A is the smallest and J is the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Middle peg is empty at start.
Right peg is empty at start.
Goal configuration: left peg top to bottom: B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top to bottom: C; right peg top to bottom: A.
Rules: only one disk moves at a time, only the top disk of a peg may be moved, and a larger disk may not be placed on a smaller disk.
Agent restrictions: agent_1 may only move disks A, B, C, D, E. Agent_2 may only move disks F, G, H, I, J.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can move disks A, B, C, D, E. Based on the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to execute. Each line must use the exact format: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and do not produce PDDL. Only include moves for disks A, B, C, D, E.

You are agent_2. You can move disks F, G, H, I, J. Based on the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you are allowed to execute. Each line must use the exact format: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and do not produce PDDL. Only include moves for disks F, G, H, I, J.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Your task is to integrate and validate their moves into a single consistent plan, resolve any ordering conflicts, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Keep the agents' actions distinct by prefixing action names with agent_1_ and agent_2_. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL encodes agent move permissions, Tower of Hanoi rules, initial state, and the final goal configuration.
pddl.prompt: You will receive two move lists: one from agent_1 and one from agent_2. Validate the moves against the public rules: only top disks may be moved and no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk. If the lists are partial or contain conflicts, reorder or annotate moves to produce a correct global plan that obeys agent disk ownership. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes the validated cooperative solution. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct and named with agent prefixes.
